snippet: The future of a hidden beach on the San Francisco Peninsula is being fought in a case that has become the latest class-charged standoff involving a wealthy entrepreneur in Silicon Valley.
abstract: Future of Martin's Beach on San Francisco Peninsula is being disputed in court battle that has become latest class-charged standoff in polarized section of California; Silicon Valley venture capitalist Vinod Khosla paid $37.5 million in 2008 for 53-acre parcel that included once-revered hideaway for beachgoers, proceeding to close gate and move to keep public off what he contends is private land.
lead_paragraph: The future of a hidden beach on the San Francisco Peninsula is being fought in a case that has become the latest class-charged standoff involving a wealthy entrepreneur in Silicon Valley.

headline.main: It’s Privacy vs. the People in the Battle for Martin’s Beach
headline.print_headline: It’s Privacy vs. the People in the Battle for Martin’s Beach
